abstract.original_text: Supplementary Methods (van der Hoek et al 2004)

sentences.segment_text: Supplementary Methods ( van der Hoek et al 2004 )

abstract.original_text: The child, who was living in Amsterdam, was admitted to the hospital (Slotervaart Hospital, Amsterdam) with complaints of coryza and conjunctivitis since 3 days. At admission she had shortness of breath and refused to drink. The patient's temperature was 39 °C, the respiratory rate was 50 breaths/min with oxygen saturation of 96% and her pulse was 177 beats/min. Upon auscultation bilateral prolonged expirium and end-expiratory wheezing was found. A chest radiograph showed the typical features of bronchiolitis. The child was treated with salbutamol and ipratropium at the first day, followed by the use of salbutamol only for 5 days.

the respiratory rate was 50 breaths/min with oxygen saturation of 96 % and her pulse was 177 beats/min .
Upon auscultation bilateral prolonged expirium and end-expiratory wheezing was found .
A chest radiograph showed the typical features of bronchiolitis .
The child was treated with salbutamol and ipratropium at the first day ,
followed by the use of salbutamol only for 5 days .
